content: the front and back of the pillow with the right sides facing out where you can see the ridges from crocheting in the back loop only and the smoother wrong sides facing in toward each other single_crochet into both row 1 of the front and row 1 of the back to join them leaving a 6 yarn tail at the start and end of the seam repeat to create the seam along the other long edge single crocheting row 55 of the front and row 55 of the back together knot the yarn tails to close the sides of the pillow before inserting the pillow form create the first row of knots on one side tie the yarn tail from row 1 of the front and the yarn tail from row 1 of the back together in a double knot tie the yarn tails from row 2 of the front and back together then repeat with the yarn tails with the rest of the row create the second row of knots gather the knotted yarn tails from row 1-10 together with the yarn tail from the seam to create a group of 11 yarn tails tie these in an overhand knot and push the knot toward the crocheted fabric to tighten repeat to tie the next group of 10 yarn tails together in one overhand knot repeat along the pillow 10 yarn tails in each knot with 11 yarn tails in the last group to form the 11th knot along one short side of the pillow insert the pillow form then repeat to create the first row of knots and second row of knots on the other side of the pillow trim each group of fringes one at a time with your sharpest scissors enjoy please feel free to sell finished items made from this pattern and give design credit as elevation pillow crochet pattern by pretty peaceful not for commercial use please do not share photos of this pattern only share the link to the pattern pdf on ravelry or youtube thank you for your support elevation pillow crochet pattern © 2025 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful
